title: So a few days back I made a post asking about why the xayah and rakan names were open, and riot said
body:
(riot support response below)

Hey there, my name is Gunny and I'm here to assist you,

In the early days of League, we reserved summoner names for each new champion that came out. We did this mostly so that we could post on the site using those champions’ names, but also as a precaution against someone taking the name and pretending to be associated with Riot Games (we don’t let people put ‘Riot’ in their name for this reason). However, there is very little danger in players using champion names, and we no longer make posts under them, so we’ve stopped reserving champion names.

We won’t take champion names away from players who currently use them for any reason, although they are still subject to decay. If a player doesn’t log into an account for a certain period of time, their summoner name becomes free. We can’t share with you when an account will become inactive, but you can read more about it here:

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751914

Gunny
Riot Games Player Support

May all your hits be crits and all your fails be tales!

-_-


Well this is very sad news... at least I have the answer now.

replies.body:
This seems really counter-intuitive, considering that previous champion names haven't been opened to be used by players. Riot should either reserve ***ALL*** champion names or ***NONE***, there is no reason to have it one way for the older names and another for the newer names, except to be biased.

I'm officially petitioning Riot to open all champion names they're currently holding from the public to be available as summoner names! Who's with me???

Given that they used to use them to post, it's entirely possible that many of the names are still held by active Red accounts or retired Riot members.  But yes I agree that should be some kind of consistency.
Not that I ever saw. From what I've seen, most of the champion name accounts have literally no match history, indicating that they simply exist to "hold" the names.
the accnts that currently hold the names of previous champs are permabanned to reserve the name

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=miF2IpMd,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-04-26T10:22:28.948+0000)
>
> Given that they used to use them to post, it's entirely possible that many of the names are still held by active Red accounts or retired Riot members.  But yes I agree that should be some kind of consistency.

They were also held so people couldn't claim to work at Riot, as there was Tryndemere and Ezreal, who are both Riot Employees. They also used to do videos with the champions and used their names to make it seem better.

Yes but the accounts used for that sort of thing most likely weren't actual played on accounts, where as those like Ezreal and Tryndamere have those names on accounts they actually play on (as far as I know). My point was that while they don't actively reserve the names anymore and therefore should release all the previous ones, there would be some names that were taken by actual people for actual accounts rather than just reserved on dummy accounts and those ones shouldn't be released.
